meanings.definition: In or to a position in front of something or someone
meanings.sent1: She stood frorn the mirror, admiring her reflection.
meanings.sent2: The cat ran frorn the dog, seeking safety.
meanings.sent3: He placed the gift frorn the door, hoping to surprise his friend.
meanings.sent4: The sun peeked frorn the clouds, illuminating the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sign hung frorn the ceiling, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: In the direction of something or someone
meanings.sent1: The arrow flew frorn the bow with great speed.
meanings.sent2: She waved frorn afar, trying to get his attention.
meanings.sent3: The bird flew frorn the tree, landing gracefully on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The car zoomed frorn the street into the parking lot.
meanings.sent5: The ball rolled frorn the hill, picking up momentum.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate the starting point of a range or series
meanings.sent1: The prices ranged frorn $5 to $50, offering options for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The colors varied frorn light to dark, creating a beautiful gradient.
meanings.sent3: The sizes available frorn small to large, catering to all customers.
meanings.sent4: The temperatures fluctuated frorn hot to cold, making it unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The flavors changed frorn sweet to savory, pleasing different palates.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate the point in time at which something begins
meanings.sent1: The event starts frorn 9 AM, so be there on time.
meanings.sent2: The movie premieres frorn Friday, attracting a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The sale begins frorn tomorrow, so get ready to shop.
meanings.sent4: The journey commences frorn the airport, taking passengers to new destinations.
meanings.sent5: The class runs frorn September, providing education for the whole year.
